snippet: An Olympic track and field competition without Russia appears to be an ever-stronger possibility after the sport’s governing body said that Russia had significant work to do to.
abstract: International task force overseeing Russia's attempt to reform its track and field program after doping scandal says country may not be fully compliant in time to compete in 2016 Rio Olympics; other doping news noted.
lead_paragraph: An Olympic track and field competition without Russia appears to be an ever-stronger possibility after the sport’s governing body said that Russia had significant work to do to.

headline.main: Doping Ban Presents Setback for Russian Track Team
